DOC.brief_summary: Anterior cruciate ligament ( ACL ) injury one common sport injury . The major problem ACL reconstruction rehabilitation program quadriceps weakness . Previous study suggest cryotherapy transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation ( TENS ) effectively reduce arthrogenic muscle inhibition cause experimental swelling . Objective : To exam effect 12 week cryotherapy TENS arthrogenic muscle inhibition subject ACL reconstruction . Design : Prospective study . Subjects : Male subject isolate ACL injury , age 18~40 year old go receive ACL reconstruction surgery . Methods : Quadriceps activation level , quadriceps peak torque maximal voluntary contraction rate force development measure presurgery , 3-month , 6-month surgery . After surgery , subject receive 12 week , 3 days/week , train program include 20 minute cryotherapy exercise training TENS . Data analysis : Data analyze use SPSS 13.0 software ( SPSS Inc. , Chicago , IL ) . One-way ANOVA use analysis data .
DOC.brief_title: Therapeutic Effects Cryotherapy Arthrogenic Muscle Inhibition Patients With Cruciate Ligament Reconstruction
DOC.detailed_description: Examination procedure : 1 . Skin preparation EMG setting . 2 . Fill knee joint function questionnaire . 3 . Warmup stationary bike . 4 . Single hop distance . 5 . MVIC test EMG recording . 6 . Endurance test . 7 . Record surface EMG vastus lateralis , vastus medialis , biceps femoris semitendinosus maximal voluntary contraction .
DOC.criteria: Male subject isolate ACL injury , age 18~40 year old go receive ACL reconstruction surgery . meniscus lesion , bony fracture osteochondral lesion
